notes: All patients were diagnosed with TTR-FAP. | not specified | novel mutation | Two patients were diagnosed with hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis. | The study highlights the presence of corneal nerve damage and functional retinal abnormalities. | Includes patients with smoldering myeloma and hereditary ATTR polyneuropathy. | First known case presenting in childhood. | Variants co-segregated with affected status in family members. | No specific variants were detailed in the text. | Variants included due to their association with late-onset disease. | Study included 40 patients |  28 diagnosed with ATTR-CM. | This variant is associated with a high penetrance for ATTR-CM. | The case highlights the importance of early detection of TTR amyloidosis. | Study provides potential insights into the aetiopathogenesis of ATTRwt amyloidosis. | No variants were seen in the remaining 5 patients. | No mutations in the TTR gene were confirmed.
